@graph.caption: No stand mixer required to make the Best EASY Chocolate Cupcakes. Moist, deeply chocolatey with a tender crumb, these are unbelievably fast & easy. www.recipetineats.com

@graph.name: Best EASY Chocolate Cupcakes (no stand mixer) | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: Moist, with a deep chocolate flavour, and made without an electric beater, these really are the Best EASY Chocolate Cupcakes. This recipe is a keeper!

itemListElement.name: Best EASY Chocolate Cupcakes (no stand mixer)

@graph.headline: Best EASY Chocolate Cupcakes (no stand mixer)

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Best Easy Chocolate Cupcakes
@graph.description: Recipe video above. These cupcakes are deeply chocolatey, they're moist - and stay moist for 3 days - and have a terrific tender crumb. It's extremely simple to make - no creaming butter, no beater required. By far the best chocolate cupcakes I've ever had made with such little effort!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup caster sugar ((super fine sugar, or sub with normal white sugar))
1/2 tsp baking soda / bi carbonate soda ((Note 1))
120g / 8 tbsp  unsalted butter (, cut into 1" / 2cm pieces (1 US stick / 1/2 cup))
60g / 2 oz  dark chocolate (, preferably 70%+ cocoa, broken into pieces (Note 2))
1/2 cup cocoa powder (, preferably Dutch processed (Note 3))
1/4 cup vegetable oil  ((or other neutral flavour oil))
120g / 8 tbsp  unsalted butter (, cut into 1" / 2cm pieces (1 US stick / 1/2 cup))
1/2 cup cocoa powder (, preferably Dutch processed)
2 1/2 cups soft icing sugar / powdered sugar ((NOT pure icing sugar))
Sprinkles and other decorations, if desired

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F (160°C fan). Put oven rack in the middle of the oven.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F (160°C fan). Put oven rack in the middle of the oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Place 12 cupcake liners in a cupcake tin.
recipeInstructions.name: Place 12 cupcake liners in a cupcake tin.

recipeInstructions.text: Sift Dry ingredients into a bowl. Whisk briefly.
recipeInstructions.name: Sift Dry ingredients into a bowl. Whisk briefly.

recipeInstructions.text: Place butter and chocolate in a separate, large heatproof bowl. Microwave for 45 seconds, mix, then microwave for another 30 seconds. Mix until chocolate is melted and smooth (keep microwaving in 20 sec bursts if chocolate not melted).
recipeInstructions.name: Place butter and chocolate in a separate, large heatproof bowl. Microwave for 45 seconds, mix, then microwave for another 30 seconds. Mix until chocolate is melted and smooth (keep microwaving in 20 sec bursts if chocolate not melted).

recipeInstructions.text: Add milk and oil, then eggs, vanilla and vinegar. Whisk until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add milk and oil, then eggs, vanilla and vinegar. Whisk until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add flour mixture and whisk until lump free.
recipeInstructions.name: Add flour mixture and whisk until lump free.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide mixture between cupcake liners. I use a ice cream scoop for this. They should be just over 3/4 full.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide mixture between cupcake liners. I use a ice cream scoop for this. They should be just over 3/4 full.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 18 - 20 minutes, or until skewer inserted into the cupcake in the middle of the tray comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 18 - 20 minutes, or until skewer inserted into the cupcake in the middle of the tray comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and immediately transfer to cooling rack (spoon or knife helps).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and immediately transfer to cooling rack (spoon or knife helps).

recipeInstructions.text: Once cool, spread with frosting and decorate with sprinkles if desired. Alternatively, use Chocolate Buttercream Frosting!
recipeInstructions.name: Once cool, spread with frosting and decorate with sprinkles if desired. Alternatively, use Chocolate Buttercream Frosting!

itemListElement.text: Melt butter then mix in cocoa powder until smooth.
itemListElement.name: Melt butter then mix in cocoa powder until smooth.

itemListElement.text: Add icing sugar and milk. Mix until smooth. Use milk to adjust consistency if required - it should be a soft spreadable consistency (like peanut butter).
itemListElement.name: Add icing sugar and milk. Mix until smooth. Use milk to adjust consistency if required - it should be a soft spreadable consistency (like peanut butter).
